doc.field: The photographs in The Views of New York, published by L. H. Nelson Company, circa 1910, are primarily views of buildings, structures, parks, and street scenes in Manhattan, though there are several views of locations in Brooklyn.

The photographs in The Views of New York, published by L. H. Nelson Company, circa 1910, are primarily views of buildings, structures, parks, and street scenes in Manhattan, though there are several views of locations in Brooklyn.

The Views of New York viewbook was published by L. H. Nelson Company, circa 1910. The photographs in the book are primarily views of buildings, structures, parks, and street scenes in Manhattan, though there are several views of locations in Brooklyn. Brief descriptions for each image are included. All images are black-and-white, and the pages measure 8" x 10". Cardboard covers have been attached to the photobook's original softcover.
L.H. Nelson Company was a publisher based in Portland, Maine. They published viewbooks (also known as souvenir albums or view albums) and photographs of prominent cities and summer resorts.
Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1974.
